page.title: 19The Women's Institute
page.content: Harlington and Barnburgh Women's Institute provides monthly meetings,incorporating varied speakers,with news of W.I. activites nationwide. Members have opportunities for a wide range of sports, crafts, drama, cultural and leisure activities. Shortage of money for local government caused an increase in Barnburgh School letting charges, where the meetings began sixteen years ago. Now,meetings are held in the Church Hall. Trees have been planted to improve the environment,refreshments provided at the Carnivals in support of the Village Hall,Cakes sold to aid Barnburgh Male Voice Choir for a 'guest' appearance in Northern Ireland and sweaters have been knitted for people in famine affected countries.
